title: Acting and being aware

references.title: Abnormalities in the awareness of action,
Directing attention to movement effects enhances learning: A review,
Expertise and the evolution of consciousness,
In the Theatre of Consciousness; The Workspace of the Mind,
Strategies and metastrategies in learning and performing self-paced athletic skills.
The Binding Problem: Induction, Integration and Imagination, ".
The role of deliberate practice in the acquisition of expert performance.’

abstract: One often assumes that we, rational human beings, first think and than act. This paper is an attempt to describe the mental characteristics governing the performance of regular everyday actions; and shows that no mental act has to precede our actions, instead of consciously thinking before we act, we mostly act while simultaneously overseeing our acting. The case of ball juggling is used to underpin the analysis with practical facts
